original: Björkman, Carl Magnus, överste, Kalmar, f. 20/12/92 i Eksjö av majoren Axel Edvard B. o. Daisy Goslett. G. 18 m. Märta Lokrantz. Barn: Bengt f. 19, flyging., Britta 20, g. m. trafikled. Frank af Petersens, Lars 29. — Stud:ex. i Linköp. 12, off :ex. 14, GCI 23, KHS 24-26. Stud. tyska arméns off :utbildn. v. Kriegsschule Dresden o. Infanterieschule Döberitz 37. Und:-löjtn. v. Andra livgren :reg. 14, löjtn. 18, kapt. i Livgren :reg. 29, v. reg. 33, major v. Norra skånska inf :reg. 37, major o. ställf. chef v. KS 40, öv:-löjtn. v. Västernorrl. reg. 41, överste i armén o. fobefälh. i Kalmar fo 44, fobefälhav. i Kalmar-Växjö fo sed. 47. Ordf. i Kalmar fo bef :utb :förb. sed. 45, led. av styr. (ordf. i verkst. utsk.) f. Kalmar 1. hemv:förb. sed. 45, ordf. i samarb ikomm. f. friv. försv:org. i Kailmar 1. sed. 45, Kgd. Maj :ts omb. i styr. f. Kalmar 1. s. skytteförb. sed. 47. RSO, RFinlVROlkl, RDDO, Landst:’SM, Kalmar Fo bfb GM, Ös-tergötl. o. ’landst :förb. SM, SkytteM.
translated:
Björkman, Carl Magnus, colonel, Kalmar, born on December 20th, 1892 in Eksjö, son of Major Axel Edvard B. and Daisy Goslett. Married in 1918 to Märta Lokrantz, and they had three children: Bengt, born in 1919 and became a pilot, Britta, born in 1920 and married to traffic controller Frank af Petersens, and Lars, born in 1929. 

Carl Magnus Björkman completed his student exam in Linköping in 1912, officer recruitment in 1914, Swedish Military Academy in 1923, and Army Staff College from 1924 to 1926. He studied at the German Army's officer training program at the Kriegsschule Dresden and Infanterieschule Döberitz in 1937. He served as a second lieutenant in the Second Life Grenadier Regiment in 1914, lieutenant in 1918, captain in the Life Grenadier Regiment in 1929, in the reserve forces in 1933, major in the Northern Scanian Infantry Regiment in 1937, major and deputy chief in the KS (Kamouflage School) in 1940, lieutenant colonel in the West Norrland Regiment in 1941, colonel in the army, and commander in Kalmar's defense area from 1944, and then in the Kalmar-Växjö defense area from 1947. 

Björkman was the chairman of the Kalmar defense education association from 1945, a member of the board and chairman of the executive committee of the Kalmar 1st home guard association from 1945, chairman of the cooperative committee for voluntary defense organizations in Kalmar 1st from 1945, and the King's Majestys representative on the board of Kalmar 1st Shooting Association since 1947. He was awarded several medals, including RSO, RFinlVROlkl, RDDO, Landst:'s SM, Kalmar's defense area commander Grand Merit, Östergötland and Gotland County SM, and Shooting Medal.
